title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 05:43 cjdelisle - (05:44): Freenode sees ipredator ip and says, register or no connection. cjdelisle - (05:44): And they don't send mail to mailinator or guerilamail :/ Denis left at 05:57 (Read error: Connection reset by peer Denis joined #xwiki at 06:05 cjdelisle is now known as cjdelisle` ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) cjdelisle` is now known as cjdelisle ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) sdumitriu left at 06:42 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds Arcainus joined #xwiki at 07:18 Arcainus left at 07:18 (Client Quit geochi joined #xwiki at 07:22 geochi is now known as Arcainus ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:29 rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:31 npm\_\_ is now known as npm ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) Arcainus - (07:34): hey all Arcainus - (07:35): i'm trying to use a snippet and tried to add it into a new created wiki page and saved it but it's not executing it. Arcainus - (07:35): i am new to using snippets and not sure what i am doing wrong sabageru joined #xwiki at 08:06 rstavro joined #xwiki at 08:24 jstoldt joined #xwiki at 08:43 jstoldt - (08:45): morning folks Arcainus - (08:56): hello tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:07 lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:09 jstoldt left at 09:13 (\*.net \*.split rstavro left at 09:13 (\*.net \*.split rrodriguez left at 09:16 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:28 vmassol - (09:30): good morning baur joined #xwiki at 09:30 rstavro joined #xwiki at 09:30 rstavro left at 09:30 (Changing host rstavro joined #xwiki at 09:30 rstavro left #xwiki at 09:30 rstavro joined #xwiki at 09:30 vmassol - (09:30): tmortagne: we'll need to talk to brainstorm about performant transformations jstoldt joined #xwiki at 09:31 tmortagne - (09:31): yep vmassol - (09:33): FTM I have a quick fix that I'm not proud of but I've thought about it for several hours and couldn't find better without breaking completely transformations jstoldt - (09:33): nothing like a good old fashioned net split in the morning :-D arkub joined #xwiki at 09:44 vmassol - (09:45): :) sburjan` - (09:45): :)) sburjan` - (09:45): you should see how often Undernet splits jstoldt - (09:47): oh, i've been around on the qnet a lot when i was younger... ;) sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:47 sburjan` - (09:48): vmassol: I was thinking how come nobody wants to improve lucene search for 3.x cycle sburjan` - (09:48): and btw, good morning :) jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:50 vmassol - (09:50): sburjan`:  good morning sdumitriu - (09:50): sburjan`: Improving the search results is critical, IMO sdumitriu - (09:51): Personally I'm a bit bummed that we're pushing for so many new features, while there are still major flaws at the basic level vmassol - (09:51): sdumitriu: you can propose things sdumitriu vmassol - (09:51): I agree too vmassol - (09:52): we're not pushing for features yet vmassol - (09:52): we haven't decided what we want to do in 3.0 yet vmassol - (09:52): :) sdumitriu - (09:52): Like, search not being usable, pessimistic locking lucaa - (09:52): ;) vmassol - (09:52): sdumitriu: propose it sdumitriu - (09:53): No, I'm not adding anything more to that heated discussion jstoldt - (09:53): about accountnotactive string sdumitriu - (09:53): I'll just keep quiet and do my own things sdumitriu - (09:54): Hi jstoldt jstoldt - (09:54): are we sending the email to confirm the account or to confirm the email-address? because the current string is a little ambigous jstoldt - (09:54): hi sdumitriu vmassol - (09:54): not good, it's about collaboration…. doing one's own thing is the easy way :) jstoldt - (09:54): ambiguous... ah what ever... it's not very clear! X-D sdumitriu - (09:54): jstoldt: confirm the account jstoldt - (09:55): okay, then we'll have to change accountnotactive\_email and make accountnotactive a little more precise. will add that to my list sabageru left at 10:00 (Quit: Leaving. evalica joined #xwiki at 10:05 jbrBridge - (10:07): [dirk] Hello! jbrBridge - (10:07): [dirk] I agree with sdumitru about flaws at the basic level. jbrBridge - (10:07): [dirk] In the last weeks I worked with xwiki from a straight user perspective - and fall at different points in different holes. jbrBridge - (10:07): [dirk] Sometime this are simple things like:  XWIKI-5698 jbrBridge - (10:07): [dirk] I like that bot :-) sdumitriu left at 10:07 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds jstoldt - (10:08): when are you folks planning to release 2.6 as final? baur - (10:08): what is the default xwiki admin username and password? sburjan` - (10:09): baur: Admin / admin baur - (10:09): i installed mysql and tomcat as a container baur - (10:09): now i can login to admin page baur - (10:10): i cant login vmassol - (10:28): oool htmlcleaner seems to be active again baur - (10:33): guys, I have installed MySql database and Tomcat server, and dowloaded xwiki-enterprise-wiki-2.5.1.war baur - (10:34): now I cant login as an admin flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 10:34 baur - (10:34): I type Admin / admin baur - (10:34): but no success baur - (10:34): and also I am trying to donwload xwiki-enterprise-wiki-2.5.1.xar this package baur - (10:34): bot it is not displayed on the availabel packages section jstoldt - (10:35): about changes.attachmentupdatedfromversion: is there actually the originating version mentioned after the string? vmassol - (10:36): guys what's the status for the 2.6 final release? what's left? Is the multiwiki issue for AS fixed? vmassol - (10:37): (rstavro, evalica: do you know?) sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:37 evalica - (10:37): vmassol: from what I know stefan needed to fix it on plugin part vmassol - (10:38): evalica: ok I do'nt remember seeing a commit so it's probably not fixed yet rstavro - (10:38): it's not fixed yet vmassol - (10:38): sdumitriu: what's left for 2.6 final? sdumitriu - (10:38): Activity evalica - (10:38): there was a patch about the refactoring too - but don't know what its status either sdumitriu - (10:38): And XE-709 if there's time for it tmortagne - (10:38): baur: by default there is no user so until you imported the xar package you can't login vmassol - (10:39): sdumitriu: we're waiting for stefan for AS? sdumitriu - (10:39): Yes rstavro - (10:39): I have a patch but it's on the activity macro side ... and yesterday you and Thomas sayd that it's better for the query to be on the plugin side sdumitriu - (10:39): He's working on it sdumitriu - (10:39): rstavro: Yes, +1 from me as well vmassol - (10:39): rstavro: it's not the same timeframe rstavro - (10:39): so, either we are waiting for Stefan, either we apply tge patch tmortagne - (10:39): baur: i can see the xar package listed on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download vmassol - (10:39): right now we need a fix for 2.6 final ASAP rstavro - (10:39): then we apply the patch vmassol - (10:40): and we can refactor in 2.7 sdumitriu - (10:40): The patch won't work nicely, since it adds the requirement of programming rights sburjan` - (10:40): sdumitriu: there still remains one issue I reported yesterday. It is a minor one. I think we can release without fixing it. The issue is :L \* XE-754 rstavro - (10:40): well, $xwiki.search also requires programming rights rstavro - (10:40): and $xwiki.search is already there sdumitriu - (10:41): Yes, and that's bad rstavro - (10:41): I know tmortagne - (10:41): what is $xwiki.search ? sdumitriu - (10:41): The fact that it's already broken is not a good reason to keep it broken for a while longer :) rstavro - (10:41): doesn't a wiki macro page have to be saved with programming rights too ? tmortagne - (10:41): rstavro: no tmortagne - (10:41): only when you want it to be exposed to the whole farm sdumitriu - (10:42): Admin rights, IIRC rstavro - (10:42): aha, ok, that's good vmassol - (10:42):         switch (visibility) { vmassol - (10:42):             case GLOBAL: vmassol - (10:42):                 // Verify that the user has programming rights since XWiki doesn't have a Wiki Farm Admin right yet vmassol - (10:42):                 // and the programming rights is the closest to it. vmassol - (10:42):                 if (this.bridge.hasProgrammingRights()) { vmassol - (10:42):                     isAllowed = true; vmassol - (10:42):                 } vmassol - (10:42):                 break; vmassol - (10:42):             default: vmassol - (10:42):                 // Verify the user has edit rights on the document containing the Wiki Macro definition vmassol - (10:42):                 if (this.bridge.isDocumentEditable(documentReference)) { vmassol - (10:42):                     isAllowed = true; vmassol - (10:42):                 } vmassol - (10:42):         } sdumitriu - (10:42): But xwiki.search checks PR on the current page, not on the macro page vmassol - (10:43): so PR for global, edit rights for wiki and user visibilities vmassol - (10:43): (edit rights on the doc containing the macro) vmassol - (10:43): for wiki macros sdumitriu - (10:43): vmassol: Is that correct? vmassol - (10:43): sdumitriu: what part? sdumitriu - (10:43): I can add a global macro if I can edit one single page? sdumitriu - (10:43): (wiki global) vmassol - (10:44): no vmassol - (10:44): you need PR vmassol - (10:44): see above vmassol - (10:44): (the code) sdumitriu - (10:44): I can add a wiki-global macro if I can edit one single page? tmortagne - (10:44): vmassol: "sdumitriu: (wiki global)" vmassol - (10:44): yes vmassol - (10:44): now is that what we want? I don't know vmassol - (10:45): it's the wiki way IMO tmortagne - (10:46): note that the macro is executed with macro author rights so it's not less safe that writing any page and waiting for someone to go there, now problem is that anyone can pollute WYSIWYG macros panel vmassol - (10:46): but yes it may require some tuning in the future; let's wait for user feedback on this sdumitriu - (10:46): K rstavro - (10:46): so what is the conclusion? we're waiting for Stefan to modify the activitystream plugin? lucaa left at 10:48 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds vmassol - (10:49): rstavro: I think so mflorea left at 10:49 (Quit: Leaving. rstavro - (10:53): ok baur - (10:55): package import does not work baur - (10:55): what the prob? tmortagne - (10:56): baur: that's what I was about to ask you :) tmortagne - (10:56): could you give use more details tmortagne - (10:56): s/use/us/ silviar joined #xwiki at 11:03 baur - (11:04): I have installed and configured MySql database and Tomcat server. I have downloaded xwiki-enterprise-wiki-2.5.1.war file and ran it on tomcat baur - (11:05): now there is an option to download this xwiki-enterprise-wiki-2.5.1.xar file sabageru joined #xwiki at 11:05 baur - (11:05): and import default pages and preferences baur - (11:05): i downloaded this file and used import baur - (11:06): however in the availabel packaegse section there is no packages availabe at all tmortagne - (11:06): do you have anything in the tomcat log ? baur - (11:07): how do i check tomcat log? rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 11:09 tmortagne - (11:09): depends of your system but it's generally in a catalina.out file Arcainus - (11:11): hey all Arcainus - (11:11): i'm trying to use a snippet and tried to add it into a new created wiki page and saved it but it's not executing it. Arcainus - (11:11): i am new to using snippets and not sure what i am doing wrong tmortagne - (11:12): Arcainus: you probably did not choose the right syntax for your page if it's an old snippet, what is the  snippet ? Arcainus - (11:13): LargeWikiExportSnippet Arcainus - (11:14): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20101116 <--- this one lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:14 tmortagne - (11:15): Arcainus: adding some more install info on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/LargeWikiExportSnippet Arcainus - (11:16): shot :) tmortagne - (11:17): done: "Edit a page in wiki mode, make sure the syntax of the page is xwiki/1.0 and save it. The snippet requires programming rights to run." jstoldt - (11:18): about core.importer.importHistory "Import history" jstoldt - (11:18): are we talking about the history of imports jstoldt - (11:18): or "import the history" sort of thing? tmortagne - (11:19): jstoldt: it's about importing the history of each page coming from the package or only the last version jstoldt - (11:19): okay jstoldt - (11:20): the German translation that existed got me confused jstoldt - (11:20): anyway, i'll propose a change to make it a little more clear in my list tmortagne - (11:20): cool :) jstoldt - (11:23): christ, reviewing 3000+ strings is really taking a lot of time :-D tmortagne - (11:25): yep and thanks a lot for doing it ;) jstoldt - (11:27): :-D jstoldt - (11:27): well, i like things to be a little more matching than they currently are jstoldt - (11:28): so best way of achieving this is having a single person review it all... tmortagne - (11:29): sure sburjan` left at 11:35 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds baur - (11:40): the problem is that packet size is too large baur - (11:40): and I dont know how to change it jstoldt - (11:41): about core.shortcuts.view.attachments and the following sburjan` joined #xwiki at 11:41 jstoldt - (11:42): any particular reason why you chose to use lowercase there? or are they converted to upper case when displayed, anyway? mflorea joined #xwiki at 11:43 jbrBridge - (11:44): [dirk] jstoldt: maybe I can help in doubt for a good german translation, feel free to contact me on jabber jstoldt - (11:44): well, i'm fine so far jstoldt - (11:45): i think i'll complete the review of XE today jstoldt - (11:45): anyway, lunchtime! YAY ;) jstoldt - (11:45): later tmortagne - (11:48): baur: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL tmortagne - (11:49): there is a command line there to change max\_allowed\_packet on mysql sburjan` left at 11:51 (Quit: 0x0 Quit Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:54 baur - (11:54): tmortagne baur - (11:55): i solved the problem baur - (11:55): it was too small space for mysql to loada the packet tmortagne - (11:56): baur: ok cool Arcainus - (11:58): thanks for the info tmortagne, i was using the wrong syntax version, but now i'm getting an error when i save the page: Arcainus - (11:58): Error number 4002 in 4: Error while parsing groovy page Howto's.Code Wrapped Exception: startup failed, Script1.groovy: 392: expecting ''', found 'n' @ line 392, column 59 Arcainus - (11:59): i searched and some people say it could be file formating and the way it was pasted into the page? i cut and pasted the code on the site and entered it as is on the xwiki page and saved the page tmortagne - (12:00): Arcainus: checking flaviusolaru left at 12:02 (Quit: Leaving. abusenius joined #xwiki at 12:03 rrodriguez left at 12:06 (Quit: rrodriguez jstoldt - (12:14): re silviar left at 12:17 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne - (12:17): Arcainus: sorry it took so long, coy paste in a page work well for me baur - (12:18): #set($reg = $xwiki.createUser(true)) how does this method creates user? tmortagne - (12:18): Arcainus: i'm copy/pasting from last Firefox 3.6 baur - (12:20): who is familiar with the application of creating users in xwiki baur - (12:20): ? Arcainus - (12:20): hmmm,  i'm on ff 3.6.12 ... i create a new page and then just paste that code into it right? tmortagne - (12:20): Arcainus: yep, you select everything that is in the box and just copy paste fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 12:21 tmortagne - (12:23): if it still does not work click "Edit" on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/LargeWikiExportSnippet and copy all you have between {{code language="none"}} and {{/code}} tmortagne - (12:23): that way you are sure to copy pure text and not html content Arcainus - (12:23): ok, let me try that rather then quick tmortagne - (12:23): but it's weird it does not work for you rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:24 tmortagne - (12:24): what version of XWiki are you using ? baur - (12:25): tmortagne, do you know someone who is familiar with user creating appication in xwiki? venkatesh joined #xwiki at 12:26 rrodriguez left at 12:27 (Client Quit venkatesh left at 12:27 (Client Quit tmortagne - (12:28): baur: a user is a page with XWiki.XWikiUsers object in it, that's pretty much all baur - (12:28): is it stored somewhere in database? tmortagne - (12:28): edit any user profile page with object editor to see tmortagne - (12:29): baur: as i said it's a wiki page rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:33 Arcainus - (12:33): tmortagne: XWiki Enterprise 2.0.3.24848 at the moment abusenius left at 12:36 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds arkub left at 12:38 (Read error: Operation timed out Arcainus - (12:41): i didn't change anything to that page :O nice bot to actually say who tries to edit but doesn't make changes. Arcainus - (12:42): or is that when the user was created silviar joined #xwiki at 12:42 flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 12:44 tmortagne - (12:50): Arcainus: did it worked for you to copy paste from edit mode ? tmortagne - (12:52): Arcainus: just reproduced it on 2.0.4 tmortagne - (12:52): looks like a groovy version issue tmortagne - (12:52): either a bug in older groovy version of a too recent syntax tmortagne - (12:52): it will try to fix it tmortagne - (12:52): since this script is supposed to work on older version of XWiki than 2.0.4 baur left at 12:54 (Quit: Page closed Arcainus - (12:57): yeah, i copied and pasted it a few ways and gave the same error, always with the groovy bit. Arcainus - (12:57): appreciate it tons :) tmortagne - (13:10): Arcainus: could you retry ? tmortagne - (13:10): no need to go to edit this time i think Arcainus - (13:11): ok, lemme try Arcainus - (13:12): sweet :) jstoldt - (13:12): is the "import" identifer used in the sense of a verb or a noun? jstoldt - (13:14): by identifier i mean identifier key in the translations and am asking about the content of the same which is prolly displayed somewhere Arcainus - (13:15): tmortagne: shot thanks :) it successfully exported and it shows in the directory. now to import it! tmortagne - (13:15): Arcainus: great :) Arcainus - (13:23): hmmm, i have a new machine with tomcat installed, mysql and the xwiki WAR file, all working 100% ... when i go create page, there is no option to select the syntax option. is that some extra "plugin" ? tmortagne - (13:24): Arcainus: nop, you should have it by default Arcainus - (13:24): odd tmortagne - (13:24): did you imported XE xar corresponding to your war version ? tmortagne - (13:25): i think the issue is that you have a 2.0.3 version UI on a whatever the new version you installed plaform tmortagne - (13:25): you need to upgrade Arcainus - (13:25): i have not imported anything yet tmortagne - (13:25): ha Arcainus - (13:26): stock standard at the moment tmortagne - (13:26): ok so the real issue is that you have nothing tmortagne - (13:26): so you ddon't have panels tmortagne - (13:26): editor right panels are pages tmortagne - (13:27): so you should import standard xar Arcainus - (13:28): aaah tmortagne - (13:29): there is a work in progress to completely get rid of editor right panels but it's not completely done yet jstoldt - (13:33): could somebody please check panelwizard.draganddrop and tell me if the (and only that one!) is there by intention or by error? jstoldt - (13:33): it seems a little random to me without a corresponding jvdrean left at 13:33 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne - (13:34): jstoldt: indeed even if it's done on purpose it seems very bad design jstoldt - (13:34): okay, will ignore it for the translation and report it along with the rest abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:43 jstoldt - (13:44): can someone tell me where panelwizard.placemanager is displayed in the panels space? jstoldt - (13:44): i can't find it anywhere Arcainus - (13:45): tmortagne: tried to save that code now and get: Arcainus - (13:45): Error number 4001 in 4: Error while parsing velocity page xwiki:Main.code Wrapped Exception: Failed to evaluate content with id code camaritei joined #xwiki at 13:45 Arcainus - (13:47): oh sorry, with this snippet - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/LargeXARImportScriptSnippet Enygma` left at 13:47 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds Arcainus - (13:50): wait, nevermind...PEBKAC issue with that one! tmortagne - (13:52): :) Arcainus - (13:54): when i exported from the one server i named it say xwiki\_import...it makes a directory? tmortagne - (13:55): Arcainus: yes exported produce a folder, you need to zip its content tmortagne - (13:55): exporter and importer scripts need some love... Arcainus - (13:55): aaah :D sdumitriu left at 14:00 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds Arcainus - (14:02): it zipping it up dependable on a certain zip program? Arcainus - (14:02): i zipped it up with unix command zip -r xwiki\_export.zip xwiki\_export Arcainus - (14:03): and when i try add the file and run it says: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file Arcainus - (14:04): be back later, chat when i get home Enygma` joined #xwiki at 14:05 jstoldt - (14:10): half way through. yay me ;) tmortagne - (14:11): Arcainus: no it's a normal zip, but you need to zip thee content of the folder, not the folder tmortagne - (14:11): it's possible you need to name it with .xar extension tmortagne - (14:12): s/thee/the/ vmassol - (14:20): sabageru: hi. Any news for the Activity stream multiwii issue fix? sabageru - (14:21): almost there. i built a function to replace the xwiki.search call . I am currently testing :) vmassol - (14:21): ok cool rrodriguez left at 14:22 (Quit: rrodriguez vmassol - (14:29): we still have a few functional tests failing in the 2.6 branch: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.6/lastBuild/testReport/ vmassol - (14:30): I haven't found a solution yet for the failing ui-test one though sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 14:30 sdumitriu left at 14:36 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds jstoldt - (14:43): anyone any idea what would be displayed after "rightsmanager.edituserprofile" jstoldt - (14:43): ? vmassol - (14:44): jstoldt: wdym by "after"? jstoldt - (14:47): well, it says "For more options to edit this user, please go to the" vmassol - (14:47): ahah found something for the ui-test issue! jstoldt - (14:47): so there is clearly something that follows this string vmassol - (14:47): jstoldt: right…. jstoldt - (14:47): and i wonder what that be in order to get the translation right vmassol - (14:47): let's search the source jstoldt - (14:47): thanks sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 14:51 jstoldt - (14:55): so? O.-) vmassol - (14:55): otp vmassol - (14:55): sorry vmassol - (14:55): https://fisheye2.atlassian.com/qsearch/xwiki?q=rightsmanager.edituserprofile jstoldt - (14:56): nice one! thanks for that link, that will probably save you a great many of my questions ;) vmassol - (14:56): hehe rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 15:05 jvelociter joined #xwiki at 15:08 jvelociter - (15:11): mflorea: Hi. did you happen to get rid of the wysiwyg plugin in XWiki recently ? jvelociter - (15:12): (the one that is declared in xwiki.cfg I mean -old school plugin type) mflorea - (15:12): jvelociter: yep, it's a service now jvelociter - (15:12): mflorea OK. I think you forgot to update XEM xwiki.cfg template jvelociter - (15:13): I had to remove it from the list when installing XEM 2.5.1 war yesterday mflorea - (15:13): hmm, I updated XE's mflorea - (15:13): so XE and XEM have different list of plugins mflorea - (15:14): there was one user complaining about this on the users mailing list but I didn't understood it was about XEM not XE mflorea - (15:14): let me fix problem tmortagne - (15:15): mflorea: yep different list of plugin because of wikimanager and appmanager jvelociter - (15:15): cool, thanks Marius tmortagne - (15:15): and there is no append systeù tmortagne - (15:15): \*system jstoldt - (15:20): okay, got two tricky ones i can't figure out with the search jstoldt - (15:20): toget <-- in what sense is this one used? to get to somewhere or to receive something? jstoldt - (15:21): type <-- as in I type something or as in it's of the green type? cjdelisle - (15:23): Is it just toget or is there a prefix behind it? jstoldt - (15:23): just toget vmassol - (15:23): jstoldt: have you tried to search for $msg.get("toget") ? jstoldt - (15:23): and just type jstoldt - (15:23): i did but i end up with a shit load of unrelated results jstoldt -
